summary: Kenneth D. Klein was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available primarily consist of payroll records and related information, including salary adjustments and termination details. The records span from 1977, indicating his employment with the HSCA during that period. While the documents detail his employment, they do not provide specific information about his role in the JFK assassination investigation or any direct connections to events or individuals related to the assassination beyond his general affiliation with the HSCA.
significance: Kenneth D. Klein's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. His payroll records document his involvement in the committee's operations, though the specific nature of his contribution is not detailed in the provided documents.
